definitions.def: Exponents less than 0. The power can be evaluated as the reciprocal of the base to thepositive power, <flashml width="54.75" height="33.75" color="33CCCC">  <math>    <mrow>      <msup>        <mi>x</mi>        <mrow>          <mo>−</mo>          <mtext>n</mtext>        </mrow>      </msup>      <mo>=</mo>      <mfrac linethickness="thin">        <mn>1</mn>        <mrow>          <msup>            <mi>x</mi>            <mtext>n</mtext>          </msup>        </mrow>      </mfrac>      <mo>.</mo>    </mrow>  </math></flashml>

secText: We use the example 10<sup class="">−5</sup> to illustrate the concept of negative exponents.

A power with a negative exponent equals the reciprocal of the power with the exponent as a positive number. We write the rule using variables: <math><mrow><msup><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>−</mo><mtext>n</mtext></mrow></msup><mo>=</mo><mfrac linethickness="thin"><mn>1</mn><mrow><msup><mi>x</mi><mtext>n</mtext></msup></mrow></mfrac><mo>.</mo></mrow></math>
In the example, 10−5 equals the reciprocal of 105, which is 1105.
When we multiply it out, we use the factor 10 five times in multiplication. The expression 10−5 equals 0.00001.
